meanings.definition: A state of temporary inactivity or suspension.
meanings.sent1: During the winter break, the school was in abeyances.
meanings.sent2: The abeyances of the project caused delays in its completion.
meanings.sent3: The abeyances of the sleepy cat made it miss its playtime.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was in abeyances, lost in a sea of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The abeyances of the clock made time seem to stand still.

meanings.sent1: The abeyances of the rain brought relief to the farmers.
meanings.sent2: The abeyances of the music startled the audience.
meanings.sent3: The abeyances of the barking dog made the neighborhood quiet.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was in abeyances, waiting for her answer.
meanings.sent5: The abeyances of the traffic allowed for a smooth commute.
